page.title: 20THE TERRITORIAL ARMY
page.content: The Territorial Army has had a branch in Braintree since 1921 and has now roughly 120 members.This branch is part of the Infantry and compliments the branches at Chelmsford and Colchester. The members are called a Company and are trained in the use of Infantry weapons and map reading.They are taught to drive army vehichles, to drill march and to respond to dis- pline. They are a reserve army and wear the uniform of the British Army.The members are paid and it varies according to rank.A private who has just started receives about Â£12.25 only if he attends meetings. The Braintree branch does not usually attend local events such as the carnival as it is usually too busy but the regular army is represented.
